thread.title: TV best bets: Mon., October 19 - TV
thread.title_full: TV best bets: Mon., October 19 - TV - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: TV best bets: Mon., October 19 - TV
text:
Buy this photo 8 p.m., FOX: Gotham — If one criminal is dangerous, a legion of them is that much worse — and that's what plagues Gotham when Galavan and Penguin (James Frain, Robin Lord Taylor) team up with a lethal family in the new episode "Rise of the Villains — Scarification." Even more trouble is afoot because of the tension between the Galavans and the Wayne clan, landing Gordon (Ben McKenzie) squarely in the middle. 
8 p.m., NBC: The Voice — The new episode "The Battles, Part 3" continues the rounds that pit same-team members against each other, with Missy Elliot, John Fogerty, Selena Gomez and Brad Paisley still onboard as guest mentors. They combine their musical expertise with that of the show's usual coaches to determine who stays in the contest, which may mean "stealing" hopefuls from another team. 
9 p.m., AMC: Halloween — Jamie Lee Curtis stars in this low-budget but high-quality 1978 horror movie from director John Carpenter. A murderous man returns after 15 years to continue the homicidal rampage he began as a young boy and appears to have some uncanny connection to baby sitter Laurie Strode (Curtis). Donald Pleasence, Nancy Loomis and P.J. Soles co-star in what has become a horror classic. 
10:01 p.m., ABC: Castle — In the "Transporter" movies, the title character wasn't permanently damaged — but someone else in that line of work isn't so lucky in the new episode "The Mask." The person is killed while trying to get a valuable artwork to its destination, and Castle and Beckett (Nathan Fillion, Stana Katic) have the help of a witness in seeking the painting and solving the murder.
